Sentencas: The electrocatalytic activity of composite anodes, consisting of micron-scale sized Pt particles and nanocrystalline Ce0.8Gd0.2O2-delta(CGO) prepared by the cellulose-precursor technique, was evaluated for the oxidation of dry methane in a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with zirconia-based electrolyte at 1173 K.
Titulo: Direct oxidation of dry methane on nanocrystalline Ce0.8Gd0.2O2-δ/Pt anodes

Sentencas: Increasing current density above 100 mA/cm(2) and the corresponding decrease of CH4/O-2 ratio down to 2-3 suppressed carbon formation, but decreased CO/CO2 molar ratio in the product mixture to 0.3-0.9.
Titulo: Direct oxidation of dry methane on nanocrystalline Ce0.8Gd0.2O2-δ/Pt anodes

Sentencas: The methane conversion rate was found to increase linearly with current, suggesting an increasing role of total CH4 oxidation by oxygen electrochemically supplied onto the anode surface.
Titulo: Direct oxidation of dry methane on nanocrystalline Ce0.8Gd0.2O2-δ/Pt anodes

Sentencas: The results show that, although ceria-based anode components are well known to improve SOFC performance, their presence leads to high CO2 selectivity and thus seems inappropriate for the generation of synthesis gas in SOFC-type reactors.
Titulo: Direct oxidation of dry methane on nanocrystalline Ce0.8Gd0.2O2-δ/Pt anodes
Direct oxidation of dry methane on nanocrystalline Ce0.8Gd0.2O2-δ/Pt anodes
Direct oxidation of dry methane on nanocrystalline Ce0.8Gd0.2O2-δ/Pt anodes
